sense.name: the act of trading or exchanging things of value between parties
sense.examples: The professor did a swap of his home in Boston for a colleague's in Paris during his year on sabbatical. The store gave Mary a swap for the oversized sweater for one that fit.

sense.name: a financial exchange of liabilities between borrowers
sense.commentary: SWAP[+event][+exchange][+financial][+of_liabilities][+between_borrowers] Note: a specific and widespread usage of Sense 1 that applies in the financial markets.
sense.examples: The two banks had arranged a currency swap. This type of swap involves exchanging a fixed interest rate for a floating rate. Chapter three of the book on portfolio theory describes bond swaps.
